title: Cancellation policy essentials
short_summary: Include notice window (commonly 24–48h), late-cancel fee (fixed or %), accepted cancellation channels, and client signature/acknowledgment.
normalized_clause_en: A cancellation policy should specify: the notice window to cancel without penalty (commonly 24–48 hours), the late-cancellation charge (fixed fee or % of service), how to contact to cancel (email/phone/text), and require client acknowledgement/signature so the fee can be enforced.

source.page_title: How to Create a Cancellation Policy (Templates + Examples)

source_quote: every cancellation policy template should include... timeframe... 24 to 48-hour notice... late cancellation penalty... contact information... place for a signature.
notes_for_llm: Adjust time windows and amounts to industry/locale; signature/acceptance is key for enforceability.

title: Short template for fixed rebooking fee
short_summary: Template: late cancellations (≤X hours) pay $Y; cancellations earlier than X hours via specified channels are penalty-free.
normalized_clause_en: Template: “Cancellations made [48 hours] or less before an appointment will be subject to a [rebooking fee of $___]. Cancellations made via [email/phone/text] sooner than [48 hours] before an appointment will be processed without penalty.”

source.page_title: How to Create a Cancellation Policy (Templates + Examples)

source_quote: Cancellations made [48 hours] or less before an appointment will be subject to a [rebooking fee of $50]... Cancellations made via [email] sooner than [48 hours]... processed without penalty.
notes_for_llm: Replace placeholders with actual hours/fee; place on quotes/contracts/booking page.

title: Percentage-based late cancellation
short_summary: Late cancellations/no-shows/access failures can be charged a % of service fee (e.g., 50%) within the notice window.
normalized_clause_en: “Cancellations made [48 hours] or less before an appointment will be charged [half of the service rate]. This includes appointments where the provider is unable to access the property, is turned away, or the client is a no-show.”

source.page_title: How to Create a Cancellation Policy (Templates + Examples)

source_quote: charged... [half of the service rate]. This includes appointments where our service provider is unable to access the property, is turned away, or the client is a no-show.
notes_for_llm: Percentage fees can feel harsh for residential; consider fixed fees or one-time waiver.

title: FTC 3-day cooling-off scope and duties
short_summary: For door-to-door/temporary sales meeting thresholds, client can cancel within 3 business days; seller must give notice/form and refund within 10 business days.
normalized_clause_en: For door-to-door or temporary-location sales meeting FTC thresholds (≥ $25 at a residence; ≥ $130 at a temporary location), Client may cancel until midnight of the third business day after the sale. Provider must supply written notice of this right and a cancellation form at signing, and refund payments within 10 business days if Client cancels within that period.
source_quote: Consumers who buy goods or services at their homes... can cancel within three business days... provide cancellation forms... refund within 10 business days.
notes_for_llm: Only triggers for home/temporary-site sales; if service starts immediately, get waiver or delay start; state law may be stricter.
